data.text:
COLLEGE

SPORTSETSU BUCS

SoCon Announces ETSU 2024-25 Menâs Basketball League Schedule

SPARTANBURG, S.C. â The Southern Conference men's basketball schedule is finalized as the league office announced its 2024-25 matchups on Tuesday.

The 18-game round-robin schedule commences on New Year's Day and comes to an end on Saturday, March 1.

For the second straight year, the Bucs will open conference play at home as ETSU hosts VMI for a New Year's Day game inside Freedom Hall. The Blue & Gold won all three matchups against the Keydets a year ago, including a 98-66 victory in the opening round of the SoCon Tournament, propelling the Bucs to a run to the title game.

Overall, ETSU will play three of its first four league games at home as the Bucs host Wofford on Jan. 4 and face The Citadel on Jan. 11.

The Bucs hit the road for the first time in league play on Wednesday, Jan. 8 as ETSU takes on Mercer. Like the VMI series, ETSU also came away with a series sweep over the Bears in 2023-24.

ETSU gets a look at the last two conference champions as the Bucs head to Greenville, S.C. for a showdown at Furman on Jan. 15, while a rematch of last year's title game with Samford is set for Saturday, Jan. 18 in Birmingham.

Furman makes the return trip to Freedom Hall on Saturday, Feb. 1, while Samford comes to town the following Saturday (Feb. 8).

Both games of the in-state rivalry with Chattanooga will be played on Saturday this season. Part I will take place in Freedom Hall on Jan. 25, while Part II in Chattanooga will be played on Feb. 15.

The Bucs' remaining home conference games feature Western Carolina (Jan. 22), UNCG (Feb. 19) and the home finale will be against Mercer on Wednesday, Feb. 26.

ETSU's other road games send the Bucs to Greensboro (Jan. 29), VMI (Feb. 5), Western Carolina (Feb. 12), Wofford (Feb. 22) and the regular season finale will be played in Charleston, S.C. against The Citadel on Saturday, March 1.

The Southern Conference Tournament will again be played inside Harrah's Cherokee Center Ashville from March 7-10. The winner will receive the league's automatic bid to the NCAA Tournament.
